column1: Bang Lamung (Thai: บางละมุง
column2: pronounced [bāːŋ lā.mūŋ]) is a district (amphoe) in the southern part of Chonburi Province

column1: Mueang Bang Lamung was formerly in Ban Bang Lamung
column3: the government downgraded Bang Lamung to a district
column4: with the district office on the banks of Khlong Nok Yang. In 1909
column7: moved the district office to the seacoast in Tambon Na Kluea.

column1: On 21 October 1952 the district office was completely destroyed by a storm. The office set up temporarily in Bang Lamung School
column2: Sukhumvit Road. The following year the Thai  government approved building a new district office near the school. It is still in use today.

column1: Neighboring districts are (from the north clockwise) Si Racha of Chonburi Province
column5: Sattahip of Chonburi Province and the Gulf of Thailand. The islands of Ko Lan and Ko Phai are in this district.

column1: The district is divided into eight sub-districts (tambons)
column2: which are further subdivided into 61 villages (mubans). The city of Pattaya is a special municipal area which covers the whole tambon Nong Prue and Na Kluea and parts of Huai Yai and Nong Pla Lai. There are a further two townships (thesaban tambon): Bang Lamung and Laem Chabang. Laem Chabang covers parts of tambon Bang Lamung
column3: and of neighboring Si Racha the complete tambon Bueng
column5: Thung Su Khla and parts of Nong Kham. Bang Lamung covers parts of the tambon Bang Lamung
column7: and Takhian Tia. The non-municipal area is administrated by five tambon administrative organizations (TAO).
